meanings.definition: relating to or denoting the formation of new tissue
meanings.sent1: The neoplastic growth in the plant was evident from the new leaves sprouting.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the neoplastic process in the body was causing the tumor to develop.
meanings.sent3: The neoplastic changes in the garden made the flowers grow in unexpected colors.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like a neoplastic force, constantly generating new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The neoplastic nature of the city skyline was ever-changing and dynamic.

meanings.definition: of or relating to a neoplasm or neoplasia
meanings.sent1: The neoplastic cells were carefully examined under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The neoplastic growth was causing concern among the medical team.
meanings.sent3: The neoplastic behavior of the puppy made it stand out from the rest of the litter.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were a neoplastic web, intertwining and growing with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The neoplastic characteristics of the painting gave it a unique and striking appearance.

meanings.definition: characterized by abnormal growth of cells
meanings.sent1: The neoplastic cells multiplied rapidly, causing the tumor to grow.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the neoplastic condition required immediate treatment.
meanings.sent3: The neoplastic behavior of the computer virus was causing chaos in the system.
meanings.sent4: Her ambition was like a neoplastic force, driving her to achieve more each day.
meanings.sent5: The neoplastic growth of the city was evident in the towering skyscrapers.
